doc.after: P. moranensis is the most widely distributed member of the Section Orcheosanthus.[4] It is also the most common and widely distributed Pinguicula species in Mexico, being found in all the major mountain ranges except Sierra Madre Occidental and Baja California.[16] Locations are known from the Mexican states of Tamaulipas, Guanajuato, Nuevo LeÃ³n, Campeche, Chiapas, Oaxaca, Puebla, Distrito Federal, Veracruz, MÃ©xico, QuerÃ©taro, San Luis PotosÃ­, Morelos, Hidalgo, Guerrero, Zacatecas, Tlaxcala, Quintana Roo, and MichoacÃ¡n and the Guatemalan departments of Huehuetenango, QuichÃ©, San Marcos, Quetzaltenango, TotonicapÃ¡n, SololÃ¡, Chimaltenango, Baja Verapaz, Guatemala and El Progreso.[6] Here it grows in mountainous regions between 800 and 3200Â meters (2600â10500Â ft) in altitude. Generally, the species tends to follow sedimentary outcrops of the Cretaceous period. P. moranensis var. neovolcanica, however, tends to grow on igneous rocks of the Trans-Mexican Volcanic Belt.[16]
